articles.name: Once Human Quest
articles.title: Once Human Quest
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: Once Human
Quest Name: Winter Survival Quest

Offer Details: Stream 15 minutes of Once Human and receive a Winter Survival Pack!

Availability Period: The Winter Survival Quest can be accepted on Discord from October 25, 2024 until October 31, 2024 (11:59PM UTC).Â 

Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward. Reward gift codes expire December 31, 2024 (3:59PM UTC).Â 

Other Terms: Limit of one reward redemption per account.

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.Â 

How to Complete the Quest

To fulfill the Quest requirement, Once Human must be played on PC and streamed through the Discord desktop app with at least one friend actively watching the stream.Â 

In order to successfully complete the Winter Survival Quest, players who meet the eligibility criteria must live stream their Once Human gameplay to a friend via a Discord voice channel for a minimum duration of 15 minutes on the desktop app.Â 

1. Before you can begin the Quest, launch the game.

2. Then, head to your Discord desktop app and navigate to a direct message (DM), group chat, or aÂ  server of your choice.

3. Once there, start a voice call or join a voice channel and select the Screen Share [] icon located in the voice status panel. Be sure to select the individual application for the game before you Go Live.Â 

Streaming to a Friend in a Discord Voice Channel

NOTE: You must select the game application to stream. Streaming your deviceâ€™s screen will not progress your Quest forward. Once you stream, you can check your progress on the Quest bar or via Quest Home (Discovery > Quests) to ensure progress is being made on the Quest.Â Â 

4. When youâ€™re ready to stream your gameplay, press Go Live. You can learn more about streaming your game here.Â 

Redemption Instructions

1. Once you have completed the Quest by streaming 15 minutes of Once Human, you will receive a reward code in Quest Home (Discovery > Quests). For detailed instructions on how to claim your reward code, please refer to our Discord Quests FAQ.

Once you select Claim Reward, the reward code will also be sent to the email address associated with your Discord account.

2. To redeem your code in-game, first complete the tutorial.Â 

3. Then, press F3 or ESC to open the event interface.

4. In the event interface, press X or select the Redeem Code button in the bottom right corner.

5. A pop-up window will appear. Enter your code and press REDEEM to claim your reward.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account.Â 

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discordâ€™s premium services are restricted in some regions.Â 

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests.Â 

A: â€‹â€‹We encourage you to review Discordâ€™s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests.Â 

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices.Â 

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows.Â 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Quest Home (Discover > Quests) or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

articles.name: Halloween Event 2024 FAQ
articles.title: Halloween Event 2024 FAQ
articles.body:
NOTE: This sound pack is available on desktop and browser only. This event was sadly too eerie for iOS and Android at this time. ðŸ‘»

Another year - another ghostly Halloween! Weâ€™ll be exchanging our normal Discord call tone for something eerier. So grab a fiend or friend and give them a call, or have them call you! Lookout for more eerie sound effects throughout as well!Â 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How long will this sound pack be available?

A: The Halloween sound pack will be available from October 24, 2024 - November 3, 2024.Â 

Q: Where can I enable this sound pack?Â 

A: The Halloween sound pack should be available automatically at 10:00AM PST.Â 

If you've disabled the Halloween sound pack, you can re-enable it. Go to User Settings > Notifications. Then select Halloween from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

Halloween Event Sound Pack in Notifications Settings

Q: Will this be available on all devices and clients?

A: The Halloween sound pack will be available on our desktop and browser clients. This event was sadly too eerie for iOS and Android at this time. ðŸ‘»

Q: Can I disable this ringtone and revert back to the default ringtone?

A: For desktop and browser users, you'll be able to go to User Settings > Notifications. Then select Discord Default from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

How to Revert Event Sound Pack to Discord Default in Notifications Settings

NOTE: If you have the Incoming Ring setting disabled, this will also automatically disable the Halloween sound pack.Â 

Q: Can I download this sound pack?

A: Sadly, there is no downloadable file for the sound pack and is only available in-client until November 3, 2024.

articles.name: My Discord Email was Changed and I Want to Undo It
articles.title: My Discord Email was Changed and I Want to Undo It
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • How to Undo an Email Address Change
  • I Got an Error When Trying to Undo My Email Change
  • How Does the Account Recovery Link Actually Work?
Note: Please note that account recovery links will become invalid after a 48 hour time period. Do not share this link to others.

Changing the email on your Discord account is a big deal! Thatâ€™s why we send you an extra email notification to the original email address after itâ€™s been confirmed.Â 

This message also includes a button to let you revert or undo the email change within 48 hours, as an extra method to keep you in control of your account.

How to Undo an Email Address Change

Note: The URL will always start with https://discord.com/wasntme/ - anything else is fake and not from Discord!

1. To start, press the button in the email notification we sent you that says Start Account Recovery.Â 

This link is uniquely generated for your account and is only valid for 48 hours - donâ€™t share it with anyone!

2. After tapping the link, youâ€™ll be taken to an Account Recovery page where you will be able to complete the following:

  • Change your Discord accountâ€™s email back to the previous email address
  • Log out the Discord account from all devices
  • Update your password
  • Remove any phone number on the Discord account
  • Remove any Multi-Factor Authentication methods on the Discord account
  • Invalidate existing recovery URLs for email changes to your account made after this one

3. To complete the process, follow the instructions after pressing Start revert process.Â 

Youâ€™ll provide a new password, and then the email address for your Discord account will be reverted to the one we sent the recovery link to - alongside the other changes listed on the page.

Note: If you had a phone number or MFA device enrolled on the account, be sure to add those back after completing the recovery process! For more details, check out the Setting up Multi-Factor Authentication Help Center article.

I Got an Error When Trying to Undo My Email Change

For technical reasons, youâ€™ll only see an error when trying to complete the password reset part of this process, and not before that.Â 

Common reasons you could see an error here are:

  • Itâ€™s been more than 48 hours since we sent you the recovery link, and itâ€™s no longer valid.
  • A recovery has already been performed on this account using a link we sent before the one being used.
  • The email address that the link was sent to is currently in use by another Discord account. To complete the account recovery, ensure that no other Discord accounts are using that email address.
  • The password youâ€™re attempting to set is invalid. For example, we donâ€™t accept passwords less than 8 characters, and some regions may have additional password requirements

Note: If your account recovery link has expired, the Discord support team is not able to send you a new one.

How Does the Account Recovery Link Work?

To ensure the security of the account (and prevent scammers from regaining access to the account after you perform the recovery), the following restrictions are in place for the recovery process:

  • The link is only valid for 48 hours.
  • If multiple recovery links have been generated for an account, using one will invalidate any that were created after the one that was used.
  • Any phone number and MFA devices associated with the account are removed.
  • You are required to change your password during this process (in case someone knows your current password), and the Discord account will be logged out from all devices.
Note: If youâ€™d like to learn more information about compromised or hacked accounts and how to report abusive behavior on Discord, please review our My Discord Account was Hacked or Compromised Help Center article.

Frequently Asked Questions

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows.Â 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

articles.name: Twitch x Discord Nitro Promotion 2024
articles.title: Twitch x Discord Nitro Promotion 2024
articles.body:
Starting from October 17, 2024 (12PM PT) to October 31, 2024 (12PM PT), Twitch users that purchase or gift 1 Twitch subscription in a channel can claim 3 months of Discord Nitro. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 3 months of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and theyâ€™ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 3 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim through Twitch by October 31, 2024 (12PM PT), and redeem in your Discord account by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT).

Membership: After the 3 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings.Â 

What this article covers:
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Twitch?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Twitch account?Â Â 
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?Â 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member?Â 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks thatâ€™ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Twitch?

Twitch is an interactive livestreaming service for content spanning gaming, entertainment, sports, music, and more. Learn more by heading to Twitch.tv.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Twitch account?

Note: The 3 months of Discord Nitro trial can be claimed on Twitch from desktop or mobile devices.

1. After the purchase requirement has been completed, you should receive a notification on Twitch about claiming your code.Â 

2. If you delete the notification or no longer see it, you can also go to your Twitch Inventory and scroll down until you see the Rewards section.Â 

3. Tap on Redeem to get the Discord 3 months of Nitro.Â Â 

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

Note: This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and theyâ€™ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

Note: Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Pressing the Promo Link/Copying and Pasting into your Browser Window

  • Start by directly pressing the promotion link or copying and pasting the promotion link into your browser window.

Note: If you're redeeming this Nitro promo link in the Discord Gift Inventory, enter only your unique 24-digit code from the Nitro promotion link in the following format: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX

Step 2 - Logging into Discord

  • Â If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Step 3 - Confirming the Correct Account and Payment Method

  • Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.
    • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________"Â 
  • If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)
  • When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button.Â 
Note: If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 4 - Subscription Now Activated

  • After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro subscription on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member?Â 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and youâ€™ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you press on and open the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion URL link in the new page and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT).

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Twitch users can claim Discord Nitro promo between October 17, 2024 (12PM PT) to October 31, 2024 (12PM PT).

After November 30, 2024 (12PM PT), Twitch users will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by October 31, 2024 (12PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 3 months of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their Twitch account?

A: Available to any purchasers of one (1) new subscription or gift subscription of any tier on any channel on Twitch.tv that has enabled the offer.

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion?Â 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and youâ€™ve never had a Nitro membership,Â  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 months Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 3 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 3 months.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and youâ€™ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like youâ€™ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an â€œSorry, looks like youâ€™ve already had a Nitro subâ€ error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 3 months perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an â€œWait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.â€ error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a â€œLooks like something went wrongâ€ error when I click on â€œNextâ€.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose.Â 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a â€œLooks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claimsâ€ error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a â€œLooks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claimsâ€ error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a â€œLooks like your email isnâ€™t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.â€

A: If you are seeing a â€œLooks like your email isnâ€™t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this giftâ€ error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasnâ€™t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article.Â 

Q: Iâ€™m having trouble with my Twitch account.

A: Reach out to Twitchâ€™s support team through here: https://help.twitch.tv/s/contactsupport

articles.name: Destiny 2: Revenant Quest
articles.title: Destiny 2: Revenant Quest
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Promotion Terms
  • How to Complete the Quest
  • Redemption Instructions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Terms

Quest Game: Destiny 2: Revenant
Quest Name: Destiny 2: Revenant Quest

Offer Details: Play 15 minutes of Destiny 2: Revenant on PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S to receive the Celestial Ties Shader.Â 

Who is Eligible: Available to players on PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S where both Discord and Destiny 2: Revenant are available. Discordâ€™s premium services are restricted in some regions.Â 

Availability Period: The Destiny 2: Revenant Quest can be accepted on Discord from October 8, 2024 until October 22, 2024 (11:59PM UTC).Â 

Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward. Reward gift codes expire December 31, 2024 (UTC -8).Â 

Other Terms: Limit of one reward redemption per account.

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.Â 

How to Complete the Quest

NOTE: To complete the Quest on PC, you must play Destiny 2: Revenant while running the Discord desktop app simultaneously.
If you decide to complete the Quest on console, the Quest tracking will begin as long as your Discord account is connected via console. For guidance on how to connect and complete the Destiny 2: Revenant Quest on console, you can refer to the following:
  • Discord and PlayStationÂ® Network Connection FAQ
  • Discord and Xbox Connection FAQ

In order to successfully complete the Destiny 2: Revenant Quest, players who meet the eligibility criteria must play Destiny 2: Revenant for a minimum duration of 15 minutes.

Redemption Instructions

1. Once you have completed the Quest by playing 15 minutes of Destiny 2: Revenant, you will receive a reward code in Quest Home (Discovery > Quests). For detailed instructions on how to claim your reward code, please refer to our Discord Quests FAQ.

Once you select Claim Reward, the reward code will also be sent to the email address associated with your Discord account.

2. Then, visit the official Destiny 2: Revenant website's code redemption page and sign into your game account.Â 

3. Enter the reward code you received.

4. After redeeming, go to the Tower in-game. Find the Special Deliveries terminal between the Cryptarch and Gunsmith to receive your Celestial Ties Shader.

NOTE: On mobile, select the Quest bar. This will bring you to the Quests tab where you can select Claim Reward.Â 

.Â 

If you dismiss the mobile Quest bar, you can still find the Quest in Quest Home (Settings > Quests) to claim your reward. For more information about Quests on mobile, see this article.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account.Â 

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discordâ€™s premium services are restricted in some regions.Â 

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests.Â 

A: â€‹â€‹We encourage you to review Discordâ€™s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests.Â 

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices.Â 

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows.Â 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Quest Home (Discover > Quests) or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

articles.name: How to Cancel your Server Subscription
articles.title: How to Cancel your Server Subscription
articles.body:
Note: If youâ€™re looking to cancel a different subscription. Please check out the corresponding article: Nitro subscription, Server subscription, or Premium App.
What this article covers:
  • How to Cancel Server Subscription on Desktop/Browser
  • How to Cancel Server Subscription on Mobile
  • How Do I Re-Subscribe After Canceling My Subscription?
  • What if I Canâ€™t Access My Discord and Need to Cancel?

Note: If you want to request a refund for your subscription instead, please check out the Refund Policy Help Center article.

You can cancel your Server subscription at any time. Once canceled, your subscription will end at the end of your current billing period.Â 

Note: Subscriptions need to be canceled on the same device type where the purchase was originally made.

For example:
If you purchased a Server Subscription through the desktop or browser app, you must cancel it through the desktop app or browser.

If you purchased through a mobile device, you can only cancel through a mobile device. If you donâ€™t have access to your device to cancel yourself, please check out this section.

How to Cancel Server Subscription on Desktop/Browser

1. Tap on the cogwheel [] next to your Discord username to access your User Settings.

2. Then head to the Subscriptions tab.

3. Here you should see a banner for your Server Subscriptions. To cancel, tap on Manage Memberships.

4. Here you will see all of your current Server Subscriptions.

To cancel, tap on the dropdown next to the Server Subscription you want to cancel and then tap on Cancel my Membership.

5. Follow the prompts to fully cancel your Server Subscription.

How to Cancel Server Subscription on Mobile

1. Tap on your avatar in the bottom right.

2. Then, tap on the cogwheel [] in the top right.

3. Next, scroll down to Billing Settings and tap on Manage Nitro. If you donâ€™t have an active Nitro subscription, youâ€™ll need to tap on Get Nitro at the top instead.

4. Here you should see all of your current subscriptions. Next to your Server subscription, tap on Cancel.

5. Now just follow the on-screen device prompts to cancel your subscription.

Once the cancellation has been completed, your Manage Nitro settings will show the date on which your subscription will expire and you will lose your subscription benefits.

Alternatively, you can also cancel your Discord subscriptions directly on your mobile device settings by following these instructions for Apple iOS subscriptions or Google Play subscriptions.

How Do I Re-Subscribe After Canceling My Subscription?

Note: If youâ€™re trying to re-subscribe on your mobile device, the steps might be a little different. Please head to the Manage Nitro tab under your User Settings in order to re-subscribe your subscription.

If youâ€™ve changed your mind and no longer wish for your Server subscription to end at the end of your billing period, then you can always reactivate it. Just make sure you do before the billing period ends, otherwise youâ€™ll just have to purchase a new subscription. Hereâ€™s how to re-subscribe:

1. Tap on cogwheel [] next to your Discord username to access your User Settings.

2. Next, navigate to the Subscriptions tab.

3. Now, tap on Re-Subscribe within the corresponding banner to uncancel your subscription.Â 

Youâ€™ll be able to tell it was reactivated, because youâ€™ll see the banner no longer has Pending Cancellation listed.

What if I Canâ€™t Access my Discord and Need to Cancel?

Note: If your Discord purchase was through an Apple device, please reach out to Apple to cancel your subscription. The Discord Support team is not able to manage your iOS subscription.

If youâ€™re unable to log into your Discord account for any reason and cancel your subscription (for desktop, browser, or even through an Android device) yourself, you can reach out to our Billing Support team under the email address tied to your Discord account and request it to be canceled through here: http://dis.gd/billing.Â 

If you want to submit a refund request instead, and your purchase is within our Refund Policy, please follow the steps outlined here.

articles.name: How to Fix Phone Errors on Discord
articles.title: How to Fix Phone Errors on Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Phone is Already Registered
  • Invalid Phone Number
  • Other Phone Errors

There are some error messages that you might notice when trying to register with, add, or change the phone number on your account. Letâ€™s go over those cases and what to do if youâ€™re experiencing those specific errors.

Before you begin the process of adding a phone number, please make sure you have access to that number and your mobile device.

Phone is Already Registered

A phone can only be registered with one Discord account at a time. If you are encountering an error that states This phone number is unable to be associated with this account, this is because the phone number is already tied to another account. As you can only have one number per account, you would need to remove the number from the other account Discord in order to use it.

Note: If youâ€™re unable to remove the phone number yourself, please check out the How to Remove a Phone Number Help Center article for steps.

Invalid Phone Number

Make sure that the phone number you are entering is properly formatted and is valid according to your countryâ€™s numbering plan.Â 

Also, make sure the phone number is not associated with a landline or VOIP device, and that the number you are trying to use is associated with a mobile device.

Other Errors

If youâ€™re running into any other error messages, or youâ€™re receiving one of the errors above and itâ€™s still not working, please reach out to our Support team for further assistance: https://dis.gd/contact

articles.name: Chargebacks FAQ
articles.title: Chargebacks FAQ
articles.body:
Fraudulently issuing chargebacks for purchases made on Discord violates our Terms of Service.

We may suspend accounts following a chargeback being filed to protect your account, our community, or our payment systems from potential abuse or fraud.

To avoid violating this policy, all refund or billing inquiry requests should be directed to our support team at dis.gd/billing instead.â â 

However, if your account has been suspended for this violation, you may appeal the suspension by submitting an appeal to Discord's Trust & Safety Team at dis.gd/request.

What this article covers:
  • What is a Chargeback
  • What This Policy States
  • How to Avoid Violating This Policy
  • How to Appeal a Chargeback Ban on Your Account

What is a Chargeback

A chargeback occurs when a transaction is reported to a payment issuer as incorrect or unrecognized.

Filing a chargeback against a transaction made on Discord may result in account suspension pending further investigation on our end. This suspension is in line with Discordâ€™s Terms of Service which prohibits actions that may cause harm to Discord and others.

This policy aims to maintain a safe and secure environment for our community while preventing potential abuse or fraud through our payment systems.

What This Policy States

Donâ€™t use the services to do harm to Discord.Â 

Among other things, this includes trying to gain access to or attacking our systems, scraping our servicesÂ without our written consent, transmitting viruses or other malicious code to our services, abusing or defrauding us or our payment systems, copying our product or using our intellectual property without permission, and misusing our reporting or customer service mechanisms.

How to Avoid Violating This Policy

We take violations of this policy seriously due to the potential harm they may cause to Discord and others. Discord's right to terminate an account following such a violation is stated in our Terms of Service.Â 

If you require a refund due to a payment issue or unrecognized activity, or if you have any billing questions, please contact our support team at dis.gd/billing. Our team will assist you according to our policies and guidelines.

How to Appeal a Chargeback Ban on Your Account

We value transparency and are committed to protecting Discord and others from harm. If your account has been suspended due to a violation of this policy, you can appeal the enforcement action taken through our support form.

On the form, select â€œAppeal an action taken on my account or botâ€ from the â€œHow can we help?â€ dropdown menu.

In the â€œWhat would you like to appeal?â€ section, select â€œAn action taken on my accountâ€.

To assist with our investigation, please provide the following information in your appeal:

  • The reason the chargeback was filed
  • If applicable, evidence of chargeback claim withdrawal
  • Screenshot of the disputed transaction on your billing statement.
    • Please ensure the screenshot displays the amount and date of transaction along with the descriptor.
Important:
  • We do not accept Discord receipts as proof as payment and this screenshot must be directly from the payment source.
  • Please note that all data associated with accounts suspended for chargebacks is deleted or anonymized 90 days after the suspension process begins.
  • If you submit your appeal after this 90-day period, we will no longer have any record of the account's existence and, consequently, will be unable to process your appeal.

articles.name: iOS Purchases on Discord FAQ
articles.title: iOS Purchases on Discord FAQ
articles.body:
What this article covers:Â 

  • iOS Purchases on Discord
  • Frequently Asked Questions

iOS Purchases on Discord

When making most purchases on Discord via iOS, there are a few important considerations to keep in mind.
Most Discord subscriptions bought through iOS (such as a Nitro, Nitro gifting, or Server Boost) or the Apple App Store are linked to your Apple ID. This is similar to how purchases work with the Google Play Store. Here's what you need to know:

  • The Discord account used for the first-time purchase of a subscription will link to the Apple ID used for the purchase.
  • Future iOS subscriptions will automatically apply to that same Discord account.
  • You cannot purchase or manage multiple subscriptions for two different Discord accounts through iOS.

If you want to purchase a Discord subscription on iOS for a different account than the one linked to your Apple account, there are a few options:

  • Try using a different device or Discord platform, such as the desktop app, to purchase the subscription on the secondary Discord account.Â 
  • If you're not using your original Discord account, you can cancel the subscription tied to it and delete the account. Once both steps are complete, you will be able to use your Apple ID on the new account. Please note: the account deletion process will take up to 15 days to complete. '
Note: Discord is unable to assist with Apple subscription issues. Discord subscriptions purchased through the Apple App Store can only be managed in your Apple settings. Users can't manage these subscriptions via desktop, browser, or Android.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How do I know if my subscription is managed through Apple?Â 

A: To check if Apple manages your Discord subscription on your iOS device, follow the steps on Apple's official website: https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/view-or-cancel-subscriptions-iph4e3e7324f/ios.Â 

To review your subscription on Discord, head into to your User Settings in the desktop/browser Discord app by selecting the cogwheel icon [] in the bottom-right corner of the app. Once there, navigate to Subscriptions where you will find you are able to review your subscription details.Â 

Example of Apple managed subscription within Discord

Q: What should I do if my Discord purchase made via iOS is marked as Past Due?

A: If your Discord purchase made via iOS is marked as Past Due, try these steps:

  • Verify that the billing address for the charged card is up-to-date and matches your bank's information.
  • Double-check that your card details are entered correctly.
  • Make sure the card hasn't expired.
  • Ensure there are sufficient funds in the account or that you haven't exceeded the credit limit.
  • Check if you've reached a pre-set spending limit on the card.

If you're still having trouble processing your subscription renewal after trying these steps, contact Apple's Support team. Visit the Apple Support page and log in with the Apple ID you used for the purchase.

Q: I purchased a subscription (Nitro, Server Boosts, etc.) on my Apple device and would like a refund. What should I do?

A: We are unable to process refunds for Discord purchases through iOS, including Nitro, Nitro Classic, Nitro Basic, gift subscriptions, and premium apps. For further assistance, please contact Apple Support by visiting https://reportaproblem.apple.com and logging in with the Apple ID used to make your purchase(s). For more information about both refund policies, please see Discordâ€™s refund policy, and Appleâ€™s refund policy.Â 

Q: I made a Server Subscription purchase via iOS and would like a refund. What should I do?Â 

A: Discordâ€™s support team can help refund a Server Subscription purchase if the request was made within 5 days from your initial purchase date. Additionally, Server Subscription refunds are a one-time only exception. To submit a refund request, head over to dis.gd/support to submit a ticket.Â Â 

Q: My friend gave me a gift credit, but I have an active subscription managed through iOS. What should I do?

A: Please be aware that gift credits cannot be redeemed on mobile devices.Â 

To use the gift credit, you will need to cancel your current subscription through your Apple device. Note that subscriptions do not end immediately; they will terminate at the end of the current billing period. Once your subscription has ended, you can redeem your gift credit by subscribing to a matching subscription using the web or desktop client.Â 

Q: I purchased a Nitro subscription and it's not appearing or working. What should I do?

A: If you purchased a subscription directly from the Apple App Store via your Apple device, the purchase should appear under the Discord account associated with your Apple ID. Check the User Settings > Billing tab within the Discord account you originally made purchases on.Â Â Â 

Q: I purchased Nitro Basic and now I want to upgrade to Nitro or add additional Server Boosts to my Server Boost subscription purchased through the Apple App Store. How can I do this?

A: To upgrade your subscription from Nitro Basic to Nitro, you'll need to manage it through your Apple device. Follow these steps:

1. Open your Settings.

2. Select Apple ID.

3. Go to Subscriptions.

4. Tap on the active subscription.

5. Select â€œSee all Plan Typesâ€ and select the subscription you wish to have.Â 

If you encounter any issues with your subscription or the upgrade process, please contact Apple Support for further assistance.

Q: Iâ€™m trying to make a Discord purchase through my Apple device and itâ€™s not working. What should I do?

A: If you're experiencing issues while attempting to make a Discord purchase on your Apple device, we recommend trying to complete the purchase on the Desktop or Web client instead. If using a different device is not an option, the problem might be related to the Apple App Store. In this case, please contact Apple Support for further assistance.

2. Then, visit the official THRONE AND LIBERTY website's code redemption page and log in to your game account. For more information about THRONE AND LIBERTY's terms and conditions, visit the official terms page.

3. While there, enter the redemption code and you'll receive the bundle via in-game mail.Â Â

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account.Â 

For more information on Discord Quests and to view the currently active quests, visit our Discord Quest Help Center.

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Some Quests will not be available in all regions based on terms and conditions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.
Additionally, Discordâ€™s premium services are restricted in some regions.Â 

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests.Â 

A: â€‹â€‹We encourage you to review Discordâ€™s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests.Â 

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices.Â 

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows.Â 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Quest Home (Discover > Quests) or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

Q: Can I still claim the Wolf Morph avatar decoration?

A: If you have completed the Wolf Morph Quest for the Wolf Morph avatar decoration by September 30, 2024, you have until October 30, 2024 to claim this offer.Â 

Wolf Morph Avatar Decoration - Enjoy until November 30, 2024 (11:59 UTC)!

What is Screen Sharing?

Note: To learn more about screen sharing, please check out the Go Live and Screen Share Help Center article. If youâ€™d rather use a Stage Channel for screen sharing, please check out the Stage Channels FAQ Help Center article.

Screen Sharing allows you to share your screen or an application window through a voice call in a server, direct message, or group message.Â 

Note: When youâ€™re in a voice call, any number of users can screen share, but only 50 users can watch an individual screen share.

How to Screen Share on MacOS

Note: Depending on the OS of your Mac device, your UI may look slightly different.

1. Join a voice channel that you have permissions to screen share in and then tap the Screen Share [] icon.

2. You can choose to share one of the following: Share entire screen, share a window, share an app, or you can tap on Or share a device to share from a device.

3. After deciding what you want to screen share, you can then select the Stream Quality, Resolution, and Frame Rate. After youâ€™re finished with your selections, tap on Next.

4. Youâ€™ll be prompted by your MacOS device to select exactly what you want to screenshare. Tap Make Selection and then press on what you want to share to select it.

5. Now youâ€™re screen sharing to the Discord app on a MacOS device!

articles.name: Message Bookmarks and Reminders
articles.title: Message Bookmarks and Reminders
articles.body:
NOTE: This feature is currently experimental and available to a limited number of Nitro members.

What this article covers:Â 

  • What are Bookmarks?Â 
  • Bookmark a Message
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • Creating a Reminder
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile

What are Bookmarks?

Discord's bookmarks feature is here to transform how you manage your conversations via chat, direct messages (DM), and group chats. Available exclusively for Nitro users, this tool allows you to:

  • Easily save important messages for later reference
  • Organize your Discord content more efficiently
  • Manage your saved items in real-time, with the ability to save or unsave messages as needed
NOTE: Bookmarks have a storage limit of 200 messages.

Never miss crucial information again! With bookmarks, you can keep track of important conversations and come back to them whenever you need.

Bookmark a Message

NOTE: As this feature is experimental, the steps may vary slightly.Â 

Bookmarking messages allows you to bookmark important information for easy access later. Whether you're using Discord on desktop, browser, or mobile, here's how you can bookmark messages:

Desktop/Browser

1. On desktop or browser, navigate to the message you would like to save.Â 

2. Right-click the message and select the Bookmark Message option in the dropdown menu, then press Bookmark.Â 

3. Once bookmarked, you will see a notification badge letting you know that the message has been saved for later.Â 

4. To view your bookmarked messages, press the Inbox icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app and select the Bookmarks tab to find your messages.Â 

On desktop/browser: To convert a bookmarked message into a reminder or unsave it, press the Inbox icon [] > Bookmarks tab. Then select the desired option in the upper right-corner of the bookmarked message.

Mobile

1. On mobile, navigate to the message you would like to save.Â 

2. Long-press the message and tap Bookmark Message in the menu.Â 

3. Once bookmarked, you will see a notification badge letting you know that the message has been saved for later.Â 

Â 

4. To view your bookmarked messages, tap Notifications [] located in the bottom hub and select the Bookmarks icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app. This will take you to the Bookmarks tab.Â Â Â Â 

Â 

Â 

On mobile: To convert a bookmarked message into a reminder or unsave it, navigate to Notifications [] > Bookmarks[]. Then tap the ellipsis [] in the upper-right corner of the message and select the desired option.Â Â 

Creating a Reminder

Reminders allow you to set notifications for important messages at a specific time.Here's how to create reminders on both desktop, browser, and mobile:

Desktop/Browser

1. On desktop or browser, select the Inbox icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app.

2. Hover over the message you would like to set as a reminder and press the Create Reminder icon [] in the upper-right corner of the message.

3. In the Remind Me menu, you can choose how long youâ€™d like to wait before being reminded.Â 

Choosing the Custom option in the Remind Me menu allows you to set a specific date and time for your reminder.

4. To view your reminders, press the Inbox icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app and select the Bookmarks tab. Here, youâ€™ll find your added reminders. Each reminder will display your chosen Due in timeframe above the message.Â 

On desktop/browser: To edit, complete, or remove the reminder, right-click the message you have set as a reminder within Inbox > Bookmarks. From there, choose your desired action.Â 

MobileÂ 

1. On mobile, navigate to the message you would like to set as a reminder.Â 

2. Long-press the message and tap Create Reminder in the menu.Â 

3. Choose when you would like to be reminded in the Remind Meâ€¦ menu.Â 

Â 

4. Once set, you will see a notification badge letting you know that the message has been set as a reminder.Â 

5. To view your reminders, tap Notifications [] located in the bottom hub and select the Bookmarks icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app.Â Â 

Â Â Â 

On mobile: To edit or remove the reminder, tap the ellipsis [] in the upper-right corner of the reminder, then select the desired option. Tap the checkmark icon [] to mark it as complete.Â Â 

Â

articles.name: Using an Authenticator App on Discord
articles.title: Using an Authenticator App on Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is an Authenticator App?
  • How to Register an Authenticator AppÂ 
    • Mobile
    • Desktop/Browser
  • Logging in With an Authenticator App

What is an Authenticator App?

Using an Authenticator App (also called a Time-based One-Time Password or TOTP) is another great way to secure your account by providing a one-time code alongside your password - this ensures that someone canâ€™t log into your account if they only have your password. You can set up an Authenticator App from your Account Settings on the mobile, desktop, and browser app.

How to Register an Authenticator AppÂ 

Mobile

1. Tap your avatar in the bottom-right corner and then tap on the cogwheel [] in the top-right corner.

2. Press on Account and then select Enable Authenticator App.

3. To begin this authentication process, you'll need to download either Google Authenticator or Authy on your mobile device.

4. Follow the instructions in the Discord app to copy your secret key into your Authenticator App so it can generate your one-time codes. Youâ€™ll be asked to enter one of those codes generated by the Authenticator App to ensure itâ€™s working properly.

5. You can now link your phone number to your Discord account to help act as a backup method for obtaining these authentication codes. This can help you be less worried about losing access to your Authenticator app, but reduces how secure your account is.

6. After enabling an Authenticator App, the Discord app will also have a list of backup codes for login: each of these can be used once instead of a code generated by your Authenticator App, in case you lose access to it. Make sure to download and store these backup codes in a safe, easily accessible place! If you lose these, Discord canâ€™t help you get back into your account.

If you set up your Authenticator App through Authy you can set up a backup by following these steps. If you set it up through Google Authenticator you can back up your account by following these steps.

Desktop/Browser

1. Start by selecting the the cogwheel [] next to your username.

2. This will open your User Settings and take you to the My Account page. While here, you will be able to view the Multi-Factor Authentication options under the Password and Authentication section.

3. Press the Enable Authenticator App button to get started. To begin the authenticator process, you will have to download Google Authenticator app or the Authy app on your mobile device. After youâ€™ve downloaded an Authenticator App, open it on your mobile device and use the camera function to scan the QR code in the Discord app.

4. After scanning the QR code that is displayed in the Discord app, your Authenticator App will generate a 6 digit code. Enter that 6 digit code into â€œLogin with your codeâ€ and then tap on Activate.

5. You can now link your phone number to your account to help act as a backup method for obtaining these authentication codes. This can help you be less worried about losing access to your Authenticator App, but reduces how secure your account is.

6. After enabling an Authenticator App, the Discord app will also have a list of backup codes for login: each of these can be used once instead of a code generated by your app, in case you lose access to it. Make sure to download and store these backup codes in a safe, easily accessible place! If you lose these, Discord canâ€™t help you get back into your account.

If you set up your Authenticator App through Authy, you can set up a backup by following these steps. If you set it up through Google Authenticator, you can back up your account by following these steps.

Logging in With an Authenticator App

After enabling an Authenticator App youâ€™ll see an additional prompt to enter an authentication code when you log in to your Discord:

Enter a code from your app or from your list of backup codes, select Confirm, and youâ€™re in!

articles.name: Requesting a Transfer of Server Ownership
articles.title: Requesting a Transfer of Server Ownership
articles.body:
If youâ€™d like to request ownership of a server, please read the information below.

If youâ€™re a server owner and youâ€™d like to transfer ownership of your server, please reference our article on how to transfer server ownership!

What this article covers:

  • What is the policy for Server Ownership Transfers?
  • How do I submit a Server Ownership Transfer Request ticket?
    • What information is needed in a Server Ownership Transfer request?
    • How do I find a Server/User ID?
  • What if my Server is Partnered or Verified?
  • What if I Want to Request an Ownership Transfer of Multiple Servers?
  • Will the Inactive Server Owner be Notified of the Server Transfer?
  • A Note on Data and Your Privacy

What is the policy for Server Ownership Transfers?

Our Discord support team can only assist with server ownership transfers if the following criteria are met:

  • The server has 100 members.
  • The current server owner hasn't accessed their account for at least a month.
  • You (the requestor) have been active on your account in the last 30 days.
  • You (the requestor) have administrator or moderator permissions within the server.
Our Support team can only assist with server ownership transfers if your request meets the criteria. If your request does not meet the criteria, then it will be deniedâ€” no exceptions.

How do I submit a Server Ownership Transfer Request ticket?

1. Visit us at https://support.discord.com/hc/requests/new

2. Under What Can We Help You With?, select Help & Support

3. Input the email associated with your Discord account

4. Under Type of Question?, select Server Related Requests

5. Under Server Related Requests, select Server Ownership Transfer Request

6. Input the requested information

What information is needed in a Server Ownership Transfer request?

In order for our support team to review your request, we will need you to submit the following information. Without the information below, we will be unable to proceed further with reviewing this request. If invalid information is provided, your request may be delayed and follow-up will be required.

  • Server Name
  • Server ID
  • Inactive owner's Discord Username
  • Inactive owner's User ID
  • New owner's Discord Username
  • New owner's User ID

How do I find a Server/User ID?

1. You must enable Developer Mode on your Discord app before you can find the server/user ID. You can check out this support article on how you can enable developer mode on your Discord app.

2. After youâ€™ve enabled Developer Mode, you can now find and copy a server ID and a User ID.

To find the user ID, right-click a userâ€™s avatar and then select Copy User ID. You can also press on a userâ€™s avatar > press on the ellipses icon in the top right corner of the userâ€™s profile > select Copy User ID.

To find a server ID, right-click the serverâ€™s name or the server icon and then select Copy Server ID.

Please note that we cannot transfer ownership if youâ€™re asking on behalf of another user, and you will need to ask that other user to directly contact our support team with their own transfer request! The new owner should be the one submitting the support ticket, unless your server is Partnered or Verified.

What if my Server is Partnered or Verified?

Before submitting a ticket, please check if your server is part of either the Partnered or Verified programs. If your server is Partnered or Verified, you will have the corresponding badge next to your serverâ€™s name. You can learn more about server types on this support article.

Please note that if your server has the Community Feature enabled, then this is not included in the Partner or Verified program. When submitting your transfer request, please only select Yes under Is your server Partnered, Verified? if your server is confirmed to be Partnered or Verified, not Community. Choosing incorrectly could delay your request processing.

After confirming that the server is part of our Partner or Verified program, only the server owner can submit an ownership transfer request.

What if I Want to Request an Ownership Transfer of Multiple Servers?

Our team can only handle one server per request. Therefore, if you want to request ownership of multiple servers, we ask that you file a separate ticket for each one.

Will the Inactive Server Owner be Notified of the Server Transfer?

If a server owner is inactive and not banned, then we do contact them to get their consent for the server ownership transfer. The current server owner has 7 days to respond to our inquiry. If they approve the transfer or they donâ€™t respond within 7 days, we transfer the server if eligible per our requirements. If the current owner denies the transfer request or the criteria for transfer is not met, we will not be able to proceed with the transfer of the server.

A Note on Data and Your Privacy

In line with data minimization principles, information provided by you in your server ownership transfer request will be deleted after the transfer is complete.

We take your privacy and data security seriously. The information collected during the server ownership transfer process, including the server name, server ID, inactive owner's Discord username and user ID, and the new owner's Discord username and user ID, will be used solely for processing your transfer request. This data will be handled confidentially and in accordance with Discordâ€™s Privacy Policy and applicable data protection laws.

articles.name: 3 Months Discord Nitro for YouTube Premium Users Promo FAQ
articles.title: 3 Months Discord Nitro for YouTube Premium Users Promo FAQ
articles.body:
Starting from October 7, 2024 (10:00AM PT)Â to March 31, 2025 (11:59PM PT), YouTube Premium subscribers within the United States can claim 3 months of free Discord Nitro.Â 

YouTube Premium subscribers within the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Japan, and South Korea can claim 3 months of free Discord Nitro from October 7, 2024 (10:00AM PT)Â to March 31, 2025 (11:59PM PT). Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 3 months of Discord Nitro for YouTube Premium subscribers

Who is Eligible: To claim through YouTube Premium, you must be a current YouTube Premium subscriber in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Japan, and South Korea.Â 

  • If you currently have a free YouTube Premium subscription, you will not be eligible to claim this promotion.

To redeem in Discord, you must redeem on the Discord desktop or browser app.

Users who have never had an active Nitro subscription on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on their account and theyâ€™ve never had a Nitro subscription, redeeming this promotion will override that subscription.

We will not be able to refund any leftover subscription time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing sub when activating the 3 month Nitro trial.Â 

Requirements:

Redeem to Discord account by April 30, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

Subscription:

After the 3 month free trial period, your Nitro subscription will convert to a monthly recurring subscription, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings.Â 

What this article covers:Â 

  • What is YouTube Premium?Â 
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from YouTubeÂ Â 
    • Eligibility for the Claiming this Promotion from YouTube
    • Step By Step Claim InstructionsÂ
